review: My wife and I recently cut our cable, and we don't miss it at all thanks to this device.  Installation was VERY trying, as it would not connect to our Wi-Fi.  As it turns out, if you have Comcast High Speed Internet, the security protocol used on the router by default would not let the Roku connect to it.  You would have to configure your modem by going to  http://10.0.0.1 and go to Connection/Wi-Fi and edit your connection settings.  I changed my security protocol to "WPAPSK-TKIP" and it works fine now.  This took hours to figure out on my own, so Roku, you lose one star for my trouble.  Also, every other wireless device in our house had to be reconnected, but it works wonderfully in both of our HDMI TV's and looks much better than it does through the Nintendo Wii.

review: This does what we wanted it to, get movies from Amazon and Netflix, so I guess that is a plus.  We have our TV mounted on the wall so we bought this thinking it was wireless (no cords at all, guess we should have researched more).  The electrical plug in for this unit sticks out from the wall approx 3 inches so make sure you have enough clearance if you plan on plugging in behind the TV.  Cord is not very long, so I have to use an extension cord to plug the unit in, something I don't like since I have small grandchildren.
